text: Toer de Gueze 2017. Draught at 3 Fonteinen lambik-O-droom. Deep red with pinkish head. The aroma has notes of raspberry, yeasts, wood and strawberry, syrupy. Sour flavor with notes of raspberry pie, wood and lemon, a bit acidic. Dry, flat, medium-bodied. Great stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2017 On tap at 3 Fonteinen lambik-O-droom during Toer de Geuze 2017. Beautiful crystal clear red color. Tons of cherries in the nose, oak and barnyard. Sour, fresh cherries, lemon peel, berries, a bit lactic, tasty. Light-bodied, dry finish. Great.
On draft at the brewery. Pours a cloudy rose with a thin pink head. Mild cherry aromas. Flavors of sour cherries and oak.
Draft - Sweet maraschino like cherry notes. Deep ruby red maroon with almost no head. Tart and light acidic cherry. Long acidic cherry finish.

Draft at the brewery from a decanter. It pours a clean deep ruby color with a small bubbly pink head. Aroma is funky lemony fruity sweet with plenty of cherries and grassy notes. Taste is also fruity and lightly funky grassy tart lemony, more cherries and almonds. Light to medium bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, tasty

A: Pours deep ruby red with little fizz and no head.little fizz and no head.
N: Overwhelming horse blanket with only a faint hint of cherry.
T: Horse blanket again with almost no detectable cherry now. Bracingly sour. Lemon notes appear.
P: Little bit of cherry and sherbet try to make an appearance before horse blanket and farmyard smells take over again, going into a long, lingering sourness. 
O: Always a privilege to drink an artisanal lambic, and this one is right up there with the best I have tasted.

Draugt @ 3 fonteinen open beer days... Pours a nice pink head keeps the entire surface covered for the entire duration of the beer. Nice opage bloodred colour... Smell forest wood cherries sours.. Taste cherries some sourness fruity...

Draught @ 3 Fonteinen Open Beer Days shared with Thompson. [Note: upon asking the staff said this was the beer] Beautiful dark red dark pink color, average sized pink head that lasts for quite a long time. Smell and taste cherries, softly sour, balanced soft cherry sour mixed with cherry sweetness. Very nice!Earlier Rating: 9/6/2014 Total Score: 3.6Sampled at the brewery thanks to kermis. Nice deep dark red color, no head. Smell and taste red fruit, cherries, lightly sour. Very dry and very fruity finish. Nice.

How: Draught.
Where: Akkurat, Stockholm.
Appearance: Red colour with a pink head.
Aroma: Cherries, sour, tart, citrus.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Sour, cherries, tart, fruit, citrus.<brEarlier Rating: 7/27/2016 Total Score: 3.9How: Draught.
Where: Akkurat, Stockholm.
Appearance: Dark red colour with a pink head.
Aroma: Cherries, fruit, a bit acidic, some tart.
Body: Full body with a thick mouthfeel, flat carbonation.
Flavour: A bit sour, sour cherries, some fruit, tart.

Draught in Akkurat, Stockholm. Shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: dark red beer, small stable reddish head.
NOSE: cherries, sour, some oak, rather sweet though.
TASTE: cherries, sour ones, somewhat sweet. Pleasant in general.Earlier Rating: 4/22/2013 Total Score: 3.6Earlier Rating: 7/17/2015 Total Score: 3.7TAP at Tour de Geuze. Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: dark red beer, stable red/white/pink head. The head stays on for almost an hour?? I thought this was lambic... could be given the wrong thing, but I asked for a Kriekenlambik so should be right.
Nose: very sour, but compensated with a red fruit sweetness. Mostly cherries noticeable.
Taste: Begins soft and fruity, but finishes rather sour. A nice beer in total, but a little to sweet in my opinion.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm, 30 Dec 2015) Dark red colour with frothy, pink head. Fruity, sourish nose with notes of cherries, citrus, grapefruit, red berries and stable. Fruity, tart taste with cherries, citrus, sour grapes, grapefruit and a dry finish with a fresh acidity. Medium body, quite dry. Fresh and tasty with a balanced cherry character and a fresh acidity. Very nice.Earlier Rating: 1/29/2016 Total Score: 3.6(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm 29 Apr 2006, 6,0% abv) Colour is deep red, no head. Nose is acidic with dark cherries and nutty hints of almonds. Taste is acidic and harsh with a fruity cherry character. Very dry but with lots of cherry character. Very well balanced and actually lovely.

Draught at Akkurat. Almost clear deep ruby liquid with medium pink head. Aroma of lemon, cherries, almonds, light funk, mineral and apples. Taste is very light sweet and medium sour with notes of lemon, apple skin, cherries and light almonds. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Awesome. Great cherry character. Earlier Rating: 6/4/2016 Total Score: 3.9Draught at 3 Fonteinen restaurant. Hazy deep ruby liquid with minimal pink head. Aroma of cherries, light almonds, apples skin, 3F funk and light lemon. Taste is light sweet and light sour with notes of lemon, cherries, almonds and light barnyard. Medium bodied with very low carbonation. Excellent kriekenlambiek.

(On tap @ Akkurat, June 4 2016) Pours lightly hazed bright ruby with a tight lasting mid-pink head and lace. Aroma has lots of fairly intense cherry flesh, some skin, marzipan, cherry pits, dried herbal notes and aromatic wood. Flavour is extremely rounded with very little of the normal kriek acidity. Lightly tart cherry juice, acidic red grape, slight currant, cherry pit, a bit metallic, dry woody finish, dry leaves, slight bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium full and creamy with low carbonation. Not as jammy and concentrated in flavour as I had been expecting though. The metallic notes distracted a touch. Very nice but not transcendent for me. Earlier Rating: 8/16/2016 Total Score: 3.9(On cask @ 3 Fonteinen Restaurant, Beersel, Nov 14 2015) Pours a very deep pink-tinged red with a short lived head of medium pink froth and no lace. Aroma of moderately heavy horse blanket/hay over kriek flesh and some pit with a faint acidic lemon touch. Palate is acidic with maybe just a little sugar, light lemon juice, kriek flesh, light skin tannins, some musty cellar and oak. Finish is pretty soft, light acidity, cherry lingers, a bit of herbal bitterness underneath. Lightish of body with no real carb. Not as juicy as the Cantillon kriekenlambic as I recall it. More wood and hay presence. Certainly a very drinkable and fairly complex kriek.

Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. Clear deep red/ruby beer with a nice pinkish head. Sourish cherry aroma, tart, grapes, rubber and citrus notes, some cherry seeds. Incredibly fresh tart cherry flavor, grapes, hay notes, fruity, cherry seeds. A beer to spend the night with! Amazing!Earlier Rating: 6/3/2016 Total Score: 4.3Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. Slightly hazy deep red/purple beer with a small but beautiful and very lasting red/pinkish head. Sourish cherry aroma, tart notes, strawberries, red currant, cherry seeds, vanilla notes, some almond and rubber.
Sweet and sour cherry flavor, red currant, almonds, tart notes, cherry seeds, vanilla notes, citrus, some grapefruit. Sourish cherry finish with grapefruit, almond and wild strawberries. Wonderful beer!
Deep red color with a pink head. Foot basement and cherry cough syrup. Long bitter finish. Sweet upfront light mouthfeel.
Draught @ Akkurat. Nice lambic witv a heavy fruitiness and a huge sweetness that sends ones thoughts to some of the american sours.
Draft Red, pink foam Aroma of wild berry, cherry and cellar Taste tart, lambic, sweet, nice fruits
Keg at Akkurat. Pours red with a pink firm head. Smooth and sweet fruity brew. Nice but too dominated by the fruitiness.
Tap at akkurat. Lovely deep red color. Highly acidic, with a lot of cherries on the nose. Wonderful craftsmanship is displays trough a fairly "simple" beer. Once again wonderful!

Pours intense red with low pink head
Aromas of tart of red currant, cherries, cracked garden branches, sour green apples, ripe fruits
Taste has very nice notes of sour cherries, red currant, sour green apples, hints of raspberries
Perfectly balanced and lovely

Tap @ Akkurats 20th anniversary. Hazy red with a creamy thick head. Cherry aroma with mild funk, green apples and grass. The taste is pleasantly tart and fruity, cherry, green apple, lemon, oak, stables and hay.

Tap at Akkurats 20th anniversary. Bright pinkish read with dense pinkish head. Huge sweet cherry aroma with marzipan, vanilla and funky barnyard. Very pleasantly pungent cherry taste with smooth funky barnyard and light oaky vanilla. Long, fruity finish. Just lovely.

Draught at Akkurats 20th anniversary party. Pours bright dense red, with thick creamy white head. Burst of authentic cherries, juicy, subdued acidity, more funk and flavor than typical drie fonteinen, perfect. The head is delicious chewy gummy fruit juice, like nothing I have ever experienced in a lambic. This beer is perfect, truly a masterpiece.

Keg at Drie Fonteinen restraurant, Beersel. Dark reddy purple, small pink head. Aroma is dark cherry, black forest, red wine. Deep rich cherry. Nice. Body is medium, smooth, watery, low carbonation for the style. Taste is cherry, stewed fruits, soft lemon tartness, light vanilla. Very nice kriek.

Tap at 3F restaurant, 20/11/15.
Rich cherry red with a well appointed crimson covering that retains well. 
Nose is tarte cherry, light smoke, cherry singed straw, wood must, funk.
Taste comprises bitter cherry skins, red berry compote, wood must, farmyard, light smoke, tangy cherry, light dirt.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close with a tarte berry scrub.
Solid.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Sampled with friends at 3 Font. Pour is murky red with small pink top. Notes are sour cherry, earth(hay), light barn, and lemon skinnage. Body is definitely on the fuller side with light carbonation.
Plum pour, small pink head. Aroma of pear blossom, orange, cherry, and funk. Flavor of cherry and barnyard.

Cask at 3F Open Beer Days. Deep red shade with a pink head. Opens with a nice and distinctive cherry sweetness before turning dry and sour. Approaches an earthy, almost chocolatey taste. The complexity of the cherries is what stood out most. On par with their regular kriek for me.
On tap a 3F. Poured a crazy cloudy red with fine pink head. Aroma sweet wet barn hay min fruits. Min carb med bod. Drying cherry tart rind taste. Kind of basic compared to their other stuff

Hand pump at 3 fonteinen. Poured a deep dark red colour with a dark pink head on top. Nose has deep sweet cherries upfront, with even Some sweet raspberries in the end. Slight acid notes, hay and green apples. Dust, no carbonation ofcourse, but a very full bodied mouthfeel. Lovely

Tap at 3 Fonteinen. Lovely ruby red color with light pink foam. Lots of cherries, berry pits, bit of hay and funk. Not very complex, just massive cherry. Light sour and bitter. Light to medium bodied with no carbonation and slight watery feel. Decent.
On handpump, this version unsweetened, lovely garnet colour with a tight pink head, no condition at all - quite flat. Fruity and lightly tart, dry-sweet and refreshing.

Draught. Dark red in color with an off-white head. Upfront theres some wooden barrels, cherries, old cellar notes and bit of sour notes in aroma. Feels quite smooth and very well balanced though. More wood, mild barnyard funkyness and some cherries in taste. Overall quite pleasant and tasty one. More cherries appears towards the end again. Good one.
Tap at Akkurat. Pours a cherry red with a slight pink head. Aroma is cherries, hay and basement. Taste is cherries, basement funk, slight citric. Beautifully balanced

Draught @ Akkurat, Stockholm 

Pours deep dark reddish with a smooth foamy head. Aroma of juicy and slightly sourish cherries, funky yeastiness, wood, tartness and farmyardy notes. Taste is surprisingly smooth and juicy with loads of tart cherries. Some sourness, oak and funky farmyardy notes too. Finish is smooth, sour and tart with some farmyardy funky notes, wood, oak and loads of cherries. Quite balanced and smooth, not very extreme. Tasty.

On tap at akkurat. Beautiful red color with a dense light pink head. Floral aroma, cherries, red berries, red bassetts candies, sweet and tart. Flavour goes the same basicly, fresh cherries, floral, sweet candies, some cinnamon and a lemon tartness. Very little carbonation, light to medium body. Beautiful!

Tap. Hazy deep ruby with pinkish head. Aroma is malt, cherries, tart, oak, fruit and barnyard. Flavour is malt, cherries, tart, barnyard, funky, medium sweet, little almond, cherry stones, little acid, sour and medium dry.
Tap @ Akkurat. Pours deep ruby red, pink head. Earthy, sour cherry aroma. Sour, earthy, deep cherry flavor.

Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. Non carbonated Kriek. Excellent fluffy pink head that stays. Clowdy red color. Sour cherry aroma with much cherry pits. Big and fresh cherry acidity. No sweetness amd fine body and tiny bitterness.
@ Akkurat 16-7-8: mycket fin doft. Helt utan kolsyra men med en stor genuin smak av körsbär och moreller. Ingen större syrlighet.

Tap @ Akkurat (25.6.2015) as "Oude Kriekenlambik". Draught version made for Akkurats 20th Anniversary.


Red, beautiful & delicious.

Unsweetened version on draught at Akkuratt. Deep red with one finger dense pink head. Aroma of cherries, funk, sourness and slight barnyard. Taste is dry with cherries, sourness/acidity, slight funk, slight hay and barnyard notes. Light and dry mouthfeel and light, almost nonexistant carbonation.

Draught at Akkurat, a version made for Akkurats 20th Anniversary. (called Oude Kriekenlambic) A bit hazy deep red with a small pink head. Nicely tart with cherries, hints of oak, some citrus and almonds. Also some sweetness in the finish. I liked this one quite a lot.

Draught @ Akkurat as "Oude Kriekenlambik" for Akkurats 20th anniversary. Unsweetened version. 
NIce fleshy cherry aroma and flavour with almonds and a nice juicy citric cherry tartness. Low to none carbonation. Very balanced. Juicy, refreshing and drinkable. I could drink this out of a bucket.

Very deep red. Aroma of sweet cherries, lots of them, slight almond vanilla, confectionery candy, bubblegum, andjavascript: RadioSel(overall,16); evened out oak vanillin, quite complex. Taste is straight up cherries, light earthy leather notes with a developing-as-it-warms up almond character, this is very good, super drinkable without carbonation, just that its a bit like juice.

Pours hazy deep red with low creamy pink head. Aroma of liquored cherries, almond icing, redcurrant and light bretta. Taste is medium to rich cherry tart with light sweetness towards the finish. Light crisp body with soft carbonation.

Extremely dark purpleish red with a leasting, semi frothy and light pink head. The nose has sour desert cherries and strawberry yoghurt, really nice! The mouthfeel is light and creamy with little carb. Sharp cherry flavour at first but settles after a while and moves towards overripe, slightly sour cherry juice. Not very tart at all, not farmy or mineral either but super fruity and juicy.

On tap at the brewery. Beautiful purple-ish color with big and stable pink head. Smell is cherries, even sweet cherries, a bit of tartness. Taste is fruity and even a bit sweet. Interesting. Not as dry as Id expected. Flat carbonation as any unblended lambic.

On tap at 3Fs restaurant. Purple-red with no head. Aroma is black cherry, almost plum, blueberry and grape, also light barnyard. Taste is sweet cherry acetic sourness. Very light carbonation. Not in good shape, decent despite the heavy acetic notes.

Nice scarlet read colour. Aroma is full of cherries and some almond. Taste is more cherries, some almond, balsamic vinegar, sugar with a nice sweet-sour balance. Aftertaste is dry. Liked it a lot, although after 3 glasses reflux started to kick in ;) draft @ 3F
Draft @ 3Fonteinen. Nice dark red colour, some pink foam. Medium carbonation. Aroma of cherries with notes of almond and candy. Sweet-sour with syrupy taste. I expected this one better. Too sweet.
Poured reddish with a frothy pink head. Aroma of tart cherry. Light, spriteful body, flavour is moderately sour cherry, seemed a bit muted to my taste.
Draft @ 3F. Red colour, no head. Smells sour, cherries, fresh, mint, dusty. Tastes sour, fresh, lots of cherry, minty. Medium body, soft carbo.

Tasted from draught at the brewery. Bright red colour, obviously no head, assertively funky aroma with loads of fresh sour cherries, some citric and lactic acid; well-rounded taste, no carbonation as expected, again a truckload of fresh fruit, nice acidity but not astringent, sweetish touch but ending in a complex, long dry finish. What a refreshing beverage on a hot day, exemplary for its style and one of the most elegant unblended cherry lambics I ever had.
(Backlog) at spontaneous fermentation. Red almost purple pour. Floral, grapefruit, tart cherry aromas. Cherry flavors are light, tart toned, spice, floral and citrus, not all that lactic.

draft (cask) at 3 Fonteinen restaurant Almost dark black red. Nose is vinegar and brown sugar. Cherries obviously. Wow the most apple cider vinegar beer ever. Makes te chest burn a bit. Lots of cherry throughout

Draught @ 3 Fonteinen Restaurant (Beersel). Deep ruby red with a huge diminishing pink head and no lacing. Aroma is of bright sour cherries with light/moderate 3F funk and hints of lemon. Taste is of freshly picked cherries with hints of sugar/sweetness, a light but nice 3F funk presence and lemony notes. Light body. Low/no carbonation. Dry finish. A tad mouth puckering. Refreshing. A little fruitier than their Oude Kriek. Sharper acidity than Cantillon Cuvée Moeder, but less fruity.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2014 Taster straight from the barrel in 3 Fonteinens barrel cellar. Pours clear red with no head. Aroma full on cherries, light funk and a little lemon. Flavor is light sweet and moderate acidic. The cherries so full on in the palate. Medium bodied with flat carbonation.

Small taster glass straight from the barrel in 3Fs original cellar. Clear deep red pour, no head. Aroma of bright, fruity cherry, light funk, very intense cherry, light leafy notes, lemon. Taste is sweet, nice cherry flavor with a tart-acidic finish, very light funk. Palate is flat and relatively dry for the sweet cherry flavors. Beautiful drink.

Drunk on draft at 3 Fonteinen in Beersel. Very strong cherry flavour. Sweetness varies but some sugar added.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear red colour, pink head. Aroma of cherries, almond, marsipan, very fruity. Sour flavour, light sweet, lemons, lots of cherry, light raspberry touch. Quite full body, long finish, cherry, marsipan, some sour notes. Kept drinking this. Sheer brilliance. Most lovely beer. Instantly forgot the hangover from the day before.
(Draught @ 3F OBD 13 / 60th anniversary)

cask at brewery
pours red , small pink foam . 
MAN thats good !
enters sweet, turns sour , extremely fullbodied and complex, cherry ( fleshy) and intence sour , after a twist ( like i said, it enters very sweet) one of the most awsome things i ever drank ..

Cask at the brewery. Perfect cherry nose, almonds, yogurt, some vanilla. Sweet cherry flavor, lemon, spices are also felt. Very tangy, quite acidic. Cherry flavor is amazing, obviously brought out by the added sugar. Quite sour, lactic, great.

Draught at the 3 Fonteinen Restaurant. Clear deep ruby, creamy pink head. Fantastic rich almond and cinnamon cherry aroma, some barnyard notes. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Semi sweet, medium acidity.

330 ml tap at 3Fonteinen restaurant. Pours deep red with purple hue and a pink head. Nose is intensely cherry, some almond, honey (added sugar) and vanilla (a tad of). Taste is sweet and sour with an exploding fruitiness; this is genuinely one of the best straight Krieks (not Oude Kriek) that I have ever had. Really like this; it drinks like water.

On tap at 3 Fonteinen Restaurant, pours a dark pinkish ruby red with a large pink head. Aroma of dry potent cherries, classic 3F funk, and more cherries. Flavour brings out both sweet and sour cherries, so pure and potent, with a touch of funk buried underneath. The cherries completely coat the palate. Excellent stuff.

Draft @ 3F during TdG 13. The pours hazy purple with a gorgeous, massive purple head. Very vivid, bright nose. Fruit orchard, bright sour cherries, pie filling, a bit of dirt and earth. The taste is earthy unwashed cherries. Lovely mild sourness. Just a hint of citric bitterness rounds the edges. Soft and so easy to drink. This is just a wonderful beverage. Fantastic.

At 3 fonteinen Restaurant, as the owner said sweetned from tap 
Head: small, white 
Colour: deep red 
Smell: slight sweet, sour, cherries, little dry 
Taste: reminds allot of de 3F Kriek, but a little dryer and sweeter, its not bad even though its sweetned, but id love to try this one without the added sugar !

On draft at 3 Fonteinen. I enjoyed one of these while chatting away with Armand on a rainy day. Anyhow, the beer is ruby red with a thick purplish, pink head. The aroma is cherry juice and hints of yeast. Much sweeter than a standard 3 Fonteinen kriek. Sugary sweet cherries, cherry pie, pie crust with hints of tartness in the finish. Lingering fruity sugars. A tasty beer for sure, but I much prefer the regular, more tart, krieks from this awesome brewery. Absolutely worth a try if you are fortunate enough to make the pilgrimage here.

30/VIII/2012 on tap @ 3 Fonteinen restaurant (Beersel) - BB: n/a (2012-984) Thanks to David for sharing the beer!
Clear dark purple beer, big creamy purple pretty dark head, bit stable, non adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, sweet forest fruits, bit sugary, woody, little cheesy, sour and sweet cherries. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: fruity start, sweet, sugary, candy, bit cheesy, red wine vinegar. Aftertaste: lemon juice, quite acidic, sweet as well, cherry juice, candy, acidic burn in the throat.

Aroma:krisebær lime citron  Ud.:rød Skum:ingen  E.smag:sød modrat sur modrat  Krop:medium For.:vanded Brus:blød  
 28-5-11@ 20th Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation

Bottle courtesy of omhper. Pours murky cherry red brown with monimal pinkish head. Aroma is siur, cellar, stable, cherries and fruity. Flavor is tart, sour, lemon juice, cherries, dry and bitter. Finishes bitter tart fruity.

From cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Beautiful rich red/pinky purple colour with a massive pink frothy head of tiny bubbles which disappears slowly. Aroma is big cherries, bit of lavender slightly funkiness and a bit sweet too. Taste is slight cherry sourness initially and then mellowing into big fruitiness. Low carbonation but tingly on the tongue. Light bodied but very drinkable. This is a very special beer.
@ ACBF 2011. The aroma has fresh cherries, some horseblanket, some marzipan. Deep red coloured beer with no head. The taste is light sour, tart is very fruity and fresh. Smooth. Really a nice one.

At Drie Fonteinen during last weeks Belgium trip. Reviewed from notes.

Served in a Drie Fonteinen tumbler.

Pours a very bright red with a two-finger, long-lasting pink head and some night lacing as it finally dies down.

The nose was full of powerful cherries. Very tart with a bit of sweetness. The cherry character in this was quite amazing. Super fresh with a nice bit of acidity in the end. Slightly puckering throughout.

The freshness of this one was unmatched and I actually enjoyed it quite a bit more than the regular Oude Kriek.

Glass at Moeder Lambic in Brussels. This was fantastic!! Bright cloudy ruby colour with a pink 2 finger head that stayed around even though the beer was essentially flat. I must admit that I love the lack of carbonation as it gives this beer a wonderfully smooth creamy texture. There was lots and lots of funk here along with the smokey cherry stones. The flavour was almonds and cherries that were very fresh. Great beer

Aroma is loads of cherry, coated in brett. Also some barn, hay and dust.
Flavour is light sourness, quite subtle, a bit watery. Massive cherry, smooth brett. Highly drinkable.
Had this one at the ACBF 2011. Red, pink colored brew. Cherries in the aroma. Flavor is moderately sour, some sweetness, cherries, smooth.
Very nice cherry beer with some fragments of bitter. Its foam is very week and has a terrible taste but the beer itself makes up for it.
Milder Kirschantrunk, angenehm mild und gleichzeitig genügend aromatisch. Sehr süffig, aromatisch und rund. Nur minimal trocken, gleichzeitig aber sehr fruchtig. Zimtnuancen im Abgang. /11/11/11//11

Tap at the 20th Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation. It pours a cloudy red grape colour, with no head or carbonation. The nose is daffodil, lily, sour red grape, wine, sweet cherry, subtle grapefruit and jammy dodgers. The taste is red grape, juicy cherry, spinach, tart red grapefruit, floral, lime and Granny Smith apple, with a dry finish. Well balanced, but not as sour as I expected/hoped for.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2013 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2011: dark pink with no head, smells of sweet, tart cherries, taste is acidic with lots of cherries, some lemon pulp, cherry pits & slightly watery, light & flat, very nice /// Had several glasses of this @ 3Fs 60th anniversary, looks absolutely radiant, quite a dark colour. Upfront it is pure kriek, some sweetness (it is sweetened but in a good (GOOD!) way) like a good batch of Girardin Kriekenlambik, pure fruit goodness, like a less brutal Intense Red. Finished with a tang of acidity not kriek but lemon acidity, very balanced, incredible stuff, so good. // upped score from 4.2 to 4.9

Deep dark ruby with a large pink head. Soft aroma, a lot of cherry, quite dry. The sweet cherry tries to cut across the funky dryness of flavour and carries on to the finish. But the dryness is more robust. Quite sharp and quenching. Soft body and flat.
Versione addolcita e riservata alla spina della kriek di 3fonteinen, buona comunque, ma non capisco proprio la necessità di addolcire un prodotto di per sé già piuttosto accessibile.

From a small box at ACBF 11.  Tasted side by side with the Scharbeekse Kriekenlambic.  This is less complex.  Far more straight forward fruit and lacks some of the intense funk of the other version.  Both are good.  This one was very drinkable, but if I had to choose, Id go for the Scharbeekse one as it had that extra level of complexity.  Still very good though.Earlier Rating: 8/26/2010 Total Score: 4.2Happy 50th Birthday Fonefan!!.  On tap at White Horse, Parsons Green.  Rich raspberry colour.  Sour cherry and some funk aroma.  Salt n Vinegar crisps.  Good fruit.  Great balanced sourness and the beer I had the most of this evening.

ACBF. Pink beer with no head. Side-by-side with the Scharbeekse. Aroma is candied cherries, woodiness. Mouth flavourful with the cherries, quite a sweet roundedness. Nice amount of yeasty funk. Brilliant beer.

(draught) pours a hazy bright ruby colour with no head. aroma of juicy cherry pulp, with a hint of citrus fruits and notes of herbs and grass, very fresh and appetizing. flavour is mostly the same, cherries, lemons and herbs, with a medium sweetness and light sour tinge, very easy to drink. medium-bodied with no carbonation.
Tap at ACBF 2011. Hazy dark pink pour. Aroma is very fruity with loads of cherries. Flavor is sweet, round and slightly sour. Very well balanced. Very refreshing. Nice.

Draught at the ACBF 2011. Special version with frozen Polish cherries. Deep red in the glass, small head. Starts mild fruity-berry, mild-sourish, not too intense. Finish still mild-fruity, a but juice-like, fruitiness dominated the sour part. Wonderful cherry aroma with every gulp. Very drinkable. Well done!
Draught @ ACBF 2011. In a side tasting with Schaarbeekse kriek. Headless perfect red pink beer. Sour cherry nose, but not very sour after all. Good funkyness & astringency.

On tap at Copenhagen Oldage on 20 May 2006. Really rather startling red colour. Soft, fruity aroma. Very dry - more so than tart/acid. Much less fruit on the palate than in the aroma. Couple that with a very flat mouthfeel (of course) and it seemed a little lacking in depth. Not my favourite 3 Fonteinen. Difficult to say when I might see this again but Ill give it another go, preferably on home turf.

A rich red coloured lambic with a slight white/pink coloured head. The aroma is sour acidity and good fruitiness. More raspberry  than cherry. The taste is nice and definitely cherry this time. Quite restrained and easy to drink.

[3243-20100802] Tap. Lovely cherry aroma of lambic yeast and tart cherry skins. Hazy, dark red body with a quick foamy white head. Super fruity cherry flavour has tons of thick sour lambic yeast and a long fruity aftertaste. Medium body. Wonderfully drinkable and a beautiful start to a night of celebratory drinking!
(fonefan Masters Division Celebration @ The White Horse, London, England)

3font krieklambic. Served from the barrel at 3 fonteinen.... Pours a  
deep raspberry reddish hue, mostly non-transparent with light bubbles,  
mostly still as it would be from the barrel... Aroma of light bouquet  
of cherry not too much of a funky essence bu rather a clean fruit  
flavor... Flavors are smooth cherry, mildly sour with a very little  
acidic bite but enough to add some slight texture and mouthfeel to the  
otherwise still/quiet lambic.
8/4/7/3/15

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2012 Served at Drie Fonteinen after finishing the most delicious Beef Carbonnade ever - August 2010.
A: Deep bloody red body. Large fizzy pinkish head. The most beautiful crash ever as the head collapsed in a wonderful crescendo. Only the faintest lacing left on the sides of the glass.
S: Waves of tart cherries. Lactic notes as well as some leather and oak. Hints at the sourness to come.
T: Delicious tart dark cherries. Lactic acid and musty oak. Lightly vinous. Potent sourness. Not much in the way of sweet cherries here.
M: Smooth, light carbonation. Refreshing dry finish. A nice tart palate cleansing drink that was a perfect complement to the delicious meal.
O: A very nice kriekenlambik. I prefer krieks to have a tad more sweetness than this did, but I certainly would never turn this one down.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2011 Sampled July 2010 at 3F Lambikodroom
I talked to Armand about the Lambic that he uses to make Kriek and he said that you want to use young Lambic from the same brew season so that you get a vigorous fermentation after adding the cherries.

This is very dark, with a concentrated cherry color, it is quite clear and typically flat; the color is just so dark, again I find it quite surprising how dark these fresh Krieks are.  This smells a bit medicinal and of plastic, but it really smells mostly of cherries that reminds me of black cherries (as opposed to the typical sour type of cherry).  Hmm, this isnt really plastic, but instead reminds me of roses; huge, expressive, floral rose aromatics just seem to expansively emanate from my glass.  Sort of potpourri like, sort of a touch like a floral soap, or perhaps even carnations might be another descriptor for the nose on this beer.

The beer is still lightly sweet tasting and it finishes with a big rose-like flavor as well as a deep berry character that seems quite vinous actually.  This is very different than the Cantillon Kriekenlambik (the Cuvee Moeder version) that I had recently or even than the Schaarbeekse Kriek versions that I have had.  The rose flavors move to notes of potpourri, berry like flavors and even the berry jam like character one finds in a red wine.  This is not as tart tasting as the Lambic I just had, but there is lots of tannic character here that seems to remind me of cherry skins that stick to the teeth.

Apparently this Kriekenlambik was from the bottom of the vat, after bottling, and it is darker and more concentrated because of it; this is part of the source of the floral character and darker color that is a typical of a Kriek.  There are also some Schaarbeekse cherries in this batch.  This is just a very nice beer, I really like how unique the cherry character is in it floral quality.

On tap at the 3 Fonteinen bar/restaurant. Pours a bright red color with a large pink head. The aroma is great; sweet woody cherries but also huge vinegar. A tart woody flavor, very tart at times, some bright sweet cherries fight through brilliantly, woody and very smooth. Wonderful. Such a nice palate on draft: smooth and easy.
On tap at Jans Masters Division Celebration, 2nd August 2010. Bright red. The perfect balance of sourness and fruitiness. The ideal expression of the style.

On Tap at the Fonefan In Masters Division party at the White Horse, Parsons Green 02/08/2010
Fruity slightly woody aroma. Red coloured a little rich on the palate and strong in alcohol with a hint of sourness in a fruity finish.
2nd tasting later in the evening : Big fruit aroma. Red coloured and rich on the palate with some alcohol present. Fruity cherry flavour with a hint of dryness in a lasting finish.
3rd tasting even later in the evening : Fruity slightly sour aroma. Dark red coloured with some alcohol present. Fruity with a hint of dryness in a lasting finish.

2nd August 2010. Fonefan in the Masters Division - Jans Birthday Bash. 
 Cloudy dark red beer. Dry crisp palate. Semi sharp sour cherry tartness. Mouth water inducing sourness. Not bad but could not drink much of this.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2011 Handpump at the 3 Fonteinen restaurant. Tasted on 25 June 2010. Cloudy dark red color and a small pink head. Aroma of sour cherrys. Taste is very sour with a slight sour cherry taste, slight citrus and a dry cherry finish. Magnificent!

Handpump at Lambik Odroom. 
Clear deep red - pink head. 
Cherry. Marzipan. Still. Lots of cherry. Light sourness. Wooden. Very pleasant.
Tap at WOSF10.  Dry musty cherry aroma.  Purple color with no head.  Sweet tart cherry malt flavor - moderate acidity.  Smooth creamy cherry aftertaste.  Very nice.

From tap at the restaurant. Pours clear and golden deep red witha small and dense pink head. Aroma i solid almondish. Almondish and fruity. Mild citric and  light malty base flavoured. Mild sourish bite into a otherwise mild finish.

rosso violaceo schiuma media persitenza media note fruttate ciliegia leggermente acerba mandolra amara leggero legno un piccola acidita in bocca un esplosione fruttata per poi avere le note di frutta secca non zuccherata abastanza secca acido medio
(Draught)  Pours an opaque reddish-violet body with no head.  Aroma of cherry, earth, and vinegar.  Flavor of cherries (thick fruit juice), vinegar, and earth with a dry finish.

Hand pump/draft @ 3 Fonteinen.
what to say, easily the best kriek I have ever had.
pours dark red going on bordeaux, thin reddish head.
aroma filled with cherries, very fresh had a nice farm/field like aroma with light tartness.
taste, lots and lots of cherries, lactic - acidic mouthfeel with notes of wood.
Overall palate kept enough sweetness not to make this a tart bomb. Amazingly natural, no feel of any additional fake extracts and sweeteners that seem to plague so many fruit beers.
Tap @ W.O.S.F. Deep red with no head. Aromas of vanilla, marzipan, cherries, cinnamon, wood, sweet and cookie-like. Flavour is tart and dry with fresh cherry notes.
Purple-red colour.  Big, full fruitiness.  Voluptuous.  Fruity, with pitty bitterness and an orchard fruit note.  Fresh and refreshing, again with pit-like bitterness to go with the tart.

WSF. Deep purple and flat. Nice floral aroma has orchids in it. Really nice with oodles of unique cherry character. Flat and smooth. Super powerful cherries in this, one of the best of the kriekenlambiks and possibly one of my favorite of all the lambiks because I love how it is just packed with cherries.

Draught at Lambicodroom. Handpump. Bloody red with a pink head. Amazing appearance which makes it a classic 5. Holy shit . . wauw. Nose is fresh cherries. Both sweet and sour. Smooth. Dry end with a small tinglin sour note. Yummi.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2010 On draught at the restaurant.  Royal red with specks.  Huge pink head.  Wonderful sour cherry flavour. 3.9.
On tap at the tasting room courtesy of Armand and his wife, shared with Arne, Bastien, Cameron.  Better body, more oak, more character.  Delicious!
Draught @ WSF 2008. Dark burgundy with no head. Sour aroma with natural cherries. Sour cherries, wood and barnyard notes in the flavor. Ends sour.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2015 Re-rate 9/20/15: Draught at 3 Fonteinen restaurant in Beersel. Amazing deep red color with a pink head. Lots of jammy cherry, a bit of medicinal notes, sweet and tart. 8/5/7/3/15=3.8 
(3/10/08) On tap at Drie Fonteinen restaurant in Beersel. Deep red, almost opaque, with medium pink head. Aroma of cherries, a bit medicinal with hints of funk. Flavor is sourish with some medicinal notes, cherries, some citrus and some sweetness as well. Light to medium body. Quite good but definitely not great. 6/5/7/3/14=3.5

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2010 2010-08-02. Hazy dark ruby red with a small off white head. 3+ Sharply sour at first, fruity second wave offers solace, but remains fairly sour. Sweet cherry notes ever so briefly, tart cherry resumes quickly thereafter. Sour finish, but not a lot in the aftertaste surprisingly. 7+ Aroma is surprisingly mild, very light funky musty notes, modest sour cherry. 7+ Average palate suits it nicely. 3+ Quite nice. Notes inexplicably end with "Oh f**k off!" for reasons I dont recall, but likely relate somehow to the choice to blend this with the De Molen shortly after writing this. Alcohol was involved. 7+/4/8/3/15+ - 3.8 2008 Vintage, FONEFAN Masters Division Celebration, The White Horse, Parsons Green, London
2008-03-07. Dark ruby red body with a large foamy pink head. Sweet cherry aroma is a tad simplistic, light musty notes. Flavour similarly starts with a strong dose of sweet cherries, and a very lightly funky sourness that slowly builds as it moves into the finish and aftertaste. (7+) Average palate. Pleasant. 7/3/7/3/15 - 3.5 On tap at 3 Fonteinen, Beersel

Weekend of spontaneous fermentation 07. 

Pours a pretty deep red with no head. Light redskin aroma, shows quite a bit of sweetness, fruity candy like. Flavours are not sour at all, a lot of grapeskin and chewy cherries. Vineous, sour finish. Very interesting to try, pretty simple but pleasing all the same.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2010 Draught @ WSF. Blood red with no head. Faint aroma of cherries and hay, a tad medicinal. Tastes much like biting into a black cherry, strong and slightly bitter. Good but I prefer the Oude Kriek (6,5,8,3,17)
Re-rate:
Fresh from the barrel @ 3 Font, poured by the man himself. Deep red with a thin ring of short lived bubbles clinging to the outside of the glass. Nose was soooo cherry but Armand explained this was made from Polish cherries and if they had been Scharbeekse it would have been 10 times more intense. Flavor was simply cherries in a glass with a little wood and lambic funk. Nothing over the top, neither too acidic nor bland, just clean and refreshing. Heaven in a glass...

On tap @ Bab festival.
Hazy deep red in colour, very little pinkish head. Aroma fruity (cherry). Medium body.
Taste cherry, little sourness, wonderfull.

on cask @ Brussels 9th Belgian Beer weekend. pours ruby with big bright pink head, never seen a head this pink! i really didnt get much of a nose, mostly cherry pits. subtle funk to it. flavor isnt very sour or tart, a sorta flabby cherry flavor that almost seems artifical. this isnt very sour, tart, or funky. mouth feel a tad watery, very low acidity. a good kriek but not up to 3 Fonteinen standards.
Deep red of color, no head. An aroma of cherries, redwine and sour notes. A flavor cherries, grapes, sour notes and dry finish.

Purple and red in colour, big pink head. Light sweetish berry aroma, a hint grain. Nutty flavorbase, citric notes, less sour than the De Cam Kriekenlambik I had before. Mellow mouthfeel, dry in the back of the throat.
On tap @ Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2007. Hazy deep red in colour.Nice and fruity with notes of wood, citrus and cherries.

Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 07.  Deep ruby, slightly cloudy.  Nose is raspberries, rosewater & lemon candy.  Quite intriguing.  Flavor is tart cherries & raspberries, lemon, wheat & yeast.  A bit of earth in the strongly red berry finish.

Dark ruby red colour, no head. Aroma is vinegar, cherry and almost a bit redwineish hints. Lots of vinegar, grapes and cherries in the very sour flavour.

Draught @ 16th Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2007, Opstal. Unclear medium red color with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate cherry, fruity, light acidic. Flavor is moderate sweet, acidic and bitter with a average duration. Very nice balance. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat.

Spontanious weekend 07. There was a problem with this beer in that pauline decided to drink it for me and then become almost sick as she was hungover and the last thing she would want is a stomach fool of acid, therefore no notes and only a score. I do recall it being very nice all the same.

Bottle. Small creamy like red head. Spar lacing. Cloudy red colour. Cherry, fresh apples, citrus, tart and dry like dusty notes as well. Medium bodied with an average carbonation. Moderated acidic flavour with hint of sweet cherry. Acidic fresh cherry finish. Belgium 26-05-2007

On draught at the brewery. Dark ruby red with a great fine-bubbled pink-purple head. Woody lambik shines through the cherry aroma. Wonderful lemony lambik with mellow cherry and almonds flavours. Balanced with quite a dry woody finish. Smooth and medium-bodied. Can a kriekenlambik get better than this?

Deep, dark red with a frothy pink head. Big pie-cherry nose, sweet wild cherry flavor becomes somewhat tart and dry on the tongue, with some sharpness in the finish. Flat but not thin. Overall: semisweet fruit, dry and refreshing.

Soda like with a pink cherry hue and nice small fizzy head. Assertive and lifted nose of cherry fruits, almost in the confectionary mould, such is the concentration. Unique flavours come out on the palate - more dead clear cherry with a powdery feel which, believe it or not, is also evident on the nose. Reminds me a lot of the chalky flavour candy I bought as a child that was packaged as an edible braclet.


(200ml e2.00 on tap @ brewery)
Partykeg at Copenhagen Beerfestival 2006Hazy ruby color. Aroma of cherry kernels. Dry mouthfeel, harsh astringency, light cherry fruitness.
Red with a light white head. Berries and sweetness in aroma. Sugary flavour with berries, fruit and only slightly sour. Had expected more but its a "must have again".

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2009 Copenhagen beer festival 2006. Red with nearly no head. Weak cherry aroma. Acidy cherry flavour and very fruity. 4.1
WSF 2009. Juicy fresh cherries. a little almond, and wooden notes. Dry and tart, with delicious fresh cherry flavour. 4.2

Draught - Bruxellensis - A rich red coloured lambic with a slight white/pink coloured head.  The aroma is sour acidity and good fruitiness.  More raspberry in my opinion than cherry.  The taste is nice and definitely cherry htis time.  Quite restrained and easy to drink.  Certainly no difficult sourness.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2006 A Mes rate: From a tiny little plastic barrel at the De Heeren Van Liedekerke 15 year celebration Garden Party and poured by Armand himself. How cool is that? A very rare and very special treat. All of the flavour and character of the usual 3FK but just a little mellower and not quite so tart. Probably due to the lack of carbonation I dont know. Initial note of sweetness is immediately overtaken by the wonderful sour cherries which just go on and on right through to the finish. Totally flat but the palate is incredible. Lipsmackingly good. An honour.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2006 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */øbenhavnske Øldage. Wow, Jeppes stand at the beerfestival was amazing. This was such a good beer and probably my favurite at the festival. No carbonation. Sour, acidic nose, with some sour cherry, blood orange and acidic tomato, slightly balsamic aswell. Palate was lovely, no carbonation, but with such a juicy acdity which made me want more and more. This was a gem.
On draft at In De Wildeman, Amsterdam. Clear dark red coloured, no head whatsoever. Cherry aroma, not very complex. Watery flavour, this is like cherry juice. Not impressed i must say.

Draught at Københavnske Øldage 2006.  Deep cherry red in colour, small dissipating pink head.  The aroma was of dark cherries, some vinegar, wood, light acidity.  The flavour is dominated by the cherries (a good thing), some wood, tart and acidic.  Dry, bitter mouthfeel, medium body, mild carbonation.  Finishes very long and dry, again with lots of cherries.  Very good stuff.

Tap, in de Wildeman. Clear red color, no head or carbonation. Aroma of cherry, but soft. Taste has a soft tartness, bit watery, cherries ofcourse, not sweet. Thin body. Quite nice, but a bit too soft.

On tap at Cph Beerfestival. Clear, cherry-red beer with no carbonation and head. Aroma of sour cherries and cellar. Some other berries as well. Tart and acidic in the mouth, with cherries dominating the flavor. Thin bodied, like a watered-down juice, but not that low on flavor. It cleans your palate quite well. (060519)

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2007 Draft pour
Consumed at the Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation, Opstal, May 2006
Slightly sweet flavor, syrupy, low carbonation.  Sweet candy-like nose of red grapes and cheap grape juice.  Really not that impressed by this one.  Simple and juice like, in my opinion.  When I sampled this the next day at the Drie Fonteinen restaurant, it was a little better.  Had a much more striking nose of sweet, rich cherries, perhaps the most full cherry nose I’ve experienced.  However, the flavor and texture didn’t impress me too much.  Thinner than hoped, simple juice like flavors at times.

Draught  Beautiful deep red body, big bubbled head; Big open incredible nose: ripe pine apple, cherry, orange peel; Balanced, thin, watery body; Into quite harsh watery finish with cherry, grapefruit, citrus. Great beer but could be much bigger (I think I have had it much bigger before!)
Draught at Københavnske Øldage 2006. Red colour with no head. Aroma of cherry and other berries. Nice acidity flavour of cherry, sourness and little woody-like. Very nice one for a lambic style.
Reddish colour with a small pink head. Fruity, light tart and sweet aroma with notes of yeast. Fruity acidic flavor with a yeasty and dusty note.
Draught. Quite clear, nice, deep red colour. No head. Slightly sour, slightly sweet, slightly nauseating cherry aroma. The flavour is quite sour and not very cherryish. No carbonation.

(On tap) Beautiful, clear red - like berry juice - no head and no carbonation. Cherries in the nose with a vague tartness. Thin and watery with distinct cherry accents. Almost light a vaguely tart fruit juice, but very quaffable. 190506

Clear ruby coloured with a light red head.
Aroma of berries, butter and wood.
Light acidic flavour of cherries, wood and fruits.
Pitcher at Københavnske øldage 2006. Pours a clear red. Rather sour but not overwhelming. Very fruity, lots of cherries. No carbonation. Aromas of resin and a hint of dirt.

Draught. Blood red-brown with a medium pink head. The aroma is quite wheaty with liberal fruity funk. Flavour is soft and wheat-driven and there is lots of cherry juiciness among brett - moreso in every aspect than the Girardin. Practically no sweetness - juicy, funky, wheaty, and super dry. Very good. 

What a great lineup of beers I had sampled at the restaurant in Beersel, on May 11, 2006.

Draught at Drie Fonteinen. Pours a lovely dark red colour with a pinksih head. Cherry aroma with hints of cherry pits and bitter almonds. Big cherry flavor with lots of tastes from the cherry pits and hints of bitter almonds. Long nice cherry aftertaste. Very nice.

Draught (ZBF06): Bloody red with a glowing pink head. Almond, cherries and marzipan in the nose. Lovely sweet cherries balanced with tart rotting grapes. Juicy, wonderful stuff that I could drink all day long (though probably get heartburn!).

Draught: Deep red coloured. Hazy. Reddish huge dense head. Distinct cherry sweetness in the aroma. Is quite marcipany. Flavour is cherrysweet with a light sourness to balance. Is quite full bodied, and a bit more sweet than the normally very sour lambics from 3 F. Is sweet and marcipanny in the end. Is quite refreshing. Good one.

Tap, ZBF 2005. Cherry red, purple-pink head and low condition. Soft sweet cherry skin aromas with some low almond notes, quite soft in the mouth with the cherry skin and stone notes just dominating the gentle lambic flavours. Cherry and almond lingering in the finish.

Small glass, restaurant Drie Fonteinen Beersel. Cherry liquor aroma. Sweet and flat. Full cherry flavor with cherry pits and bitter almonds. Full bodied. A bit alcoholic. The essence of cherries packed in a glass. Absolutely great beer! Wished I could have more, but I had to drive.

Hand pump at 3 Fonteinen (restaurant) along with a dish of rabbit in geuze!!A true beauty - unclear deep red with a frothy pink head. Very nice and full sweet cherry and creamy aroma. Dry woody cherry flavor with a sour grapefruit note. More sourness than other kriekenlambics I have had. Sharp, dry, penetrating, outstanding!

Draught (hand pump), Beersel, 3 Fonteinen, May 2005.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, pink, fully diminishing.
Body is dark red.

Aroma is lightly yeast (barnyard), with notes of cherry and cassis.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic.

Medium body, watery texture, soft/flat carbonation, lightly astringent.

Surprisingly uninteresting, non-serious kriek.  Almost everything Armand makes is amazing, but this one was a bit disappointing at the time I had it.
Zythos Beer Festival, Sint-Niklaas, Belgium 2005. Cloudy orange colour with no head. Light sour cherry aroma and taste. Medium body and a light sour finish.
ZBF 2005. Pours a deep red, with frothy pink head. Aroma is of fresh cherries, and some funky brett. Taste is sour, cherries, and some yeasty complexicity
This beer has a verry light pink head and was darkred colored and somewhat cloudy. The cherry aroma gave a sweet touch, the taste as well,  very complex but good.

Thanks to DrNate03 for driving us to Drie Fonteinen! Had this with lunch. Came from a handpump. Chery/raspberry colored body with no head. Nose is cherry but leaning towards sweet rather than sour. Taste is pleasant dark cherry tartness but its mild almost juice like at points. Like a cherry cough drop at points, as well. Body is light feeling with almost no acidity. Finish is semisweet with more cherry flavors coming through.

As Oude Kriek draft from 3 Fonteinen, which for the time being I assume to be the Kriekenlambic. Complex deep cherry aroma, sweet but subtle, tannic. Blood red hazy with no head. Light body with light carbonation, like juice. Starts with mild sweetness, medium cherry flavor, and mild acidity. Very mild overall, and more like a juice than gueuze. Great refreshing drink. Mild fruit finish and clean fruity after.
Draught form Jacobs refridgeator. Natural taste and sour as hell. I like this very much, but not for people with a bad heart.
Draught. Low carbonation. Extremely fresh and very sour. Fantastic natural cherry flavour. This was the beer I drank the most of at ZBF 2004.

Red colour.
Sweet cherry aroma with a fresh acidic twang.
Sweet cherry flavor with tones of maraschino. Spicy and dry bitterness.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2006 This rating is for the "Sweet Kriekenlambic", 6.5%. Sampled from cask at Akkurat, Stockholm.
Its supposedly made from unblended lambic and schaarbeekse cherries, and is marginally sweetened.
Deep clear red. Aroma of ripe cherrues and vinegar. Sweet and woody, full of wonderful balsamic schaarbeekse cherries. Low carbonation, but the mouthfeel is fresh, lively and sparkling. Grape stone finish with a bit too much sweetness. Mindboggingly tasty.

Additional rating for the "Dry Kriekenlambic", 6.5%. Sampled from cask at Akkurat, Stockholm.
The same magnificent cherry aroma as the sweetened version, but this is significantly drier and more acidic. On paper this is something I like, but instead it doesnt carry the wonderful flavour of the schaarbeekse cherries as well as the sweetened version. The mouthfeel is still as soft and sparkling, and I still regard this version as ultra-superb, just a tad less wonderful than the sweetened one. (10/5/9/5/17)
UPDATED: JUL 3, 2009 Hazy red body.  Sourish aroma of cherries, wine, wood, ...  Modertately sour, lightly sweet flavour.  Tastes like eating sour cherries.  Just great!

An opague red beer with a foamy pink head. The aroma is sweet and as a kriek should smell, cherries, wood, and more. The flavor is a perfect combination of sweet cherries and sour lambic. With the sourness drawing out the mouthwater.

Drie Fonteinen has in fact two different versions. One sweetened and only available on tap at the restaurant at the brewery. And one unsweetened also available in a bottle. This rating is the unsweetened one on tap at the brewery! Light tart and oak, cherry aroma. Red/pink colour, large pink head, lots of bubbles. Light sweet, light sour and you taste the overaged hops slightly in the background. Sour and bitter finish, long but not intense.

Of all the sweet fruit lambics brewed in belgium, this must be the best.  It is a burgandy coloured beer with almost no head or carbonation.  The aroma is rich in sweet cherries as is the flavour.  In fact, I could only describe this beer as a mouth full of sour cherries but with a very complex gueuze base and enough sweetness to appeal to the bellevue/lindeman drikers.  This was the most refreshing beer I had in belgium and if I was to go back, I would consecrate one day to sit on their patio and drink this all fn day. As Joris said, this is nearing perfection, especially in terms of drinkability.

For all clarity, this is the unblended, unsweetened version, also available on draught at the restaurant. Deep-deep burgundy, with bright red "éclat", no head. Nose of cherries, cherries, ch.. and vanilla. Taste like an explosion of freshly pressed fruit(juice). Then some wood, and an estery, alcoholic difference with real fruitjuice. Very woody finish. Tart, like some sour cherries (=krieken), plucked from the tree. Chewy. In the palate there is still some woodiness, but it suddenly disappears. Nearing perfection. One cannot get enough of this. Unlike one's stomach lining...
